item.title: What I'm learning and its timeline
item.description:
Intro

At this point, it would be useful to layout exactly what I plan on learning. Having everything laid out and planned makes it easier to keep progressing. This timeline will be for 30 days.

I’ll primarily be focusing on learning (or relearning) the Python programming language. To accomplish this, I’ll be following “Python Crash Course” by Eric Matthes.

I chose this particular book mainly for Part II of the book which is focused on 3 different types of projects. Along with that, each chapter ends with several exercises to reinforce the lessons. For anyone curious, I’ll be using Python 3 to go through the book.

Timeline

  • Days 1 - 5: Chapters 1 - 4
  • Days 6 - 10: Chapters 5 - 8
  • Days 11 - 15: Chapters 9 - 11
  • Days 16 - 20: Chapters 12 - 14 (Project 1)
  • Days 21 - 25: Chapters 15 - 17 (Project 2)
  • Days 26 - 30: Chapters 18 - 20 (Project 3)

You can find the table of contents for “Python Crash Course” here.

For those who remember learning programming this timeline is obviously aggressive. The reason this timeline is so aggressive is because I have previous programming experience. In Python at that.

These 30 days will serve more as a reintroduction to the world of programming and Python. I’ll be posting updates every 5 days. However, you will see commits over on my Github everyday.

Until next time…

– grxgs

item.title: About Me
item.description: I’m going to try and keep this short and simple. I’m just a simple person whose trying to get into software development. Along with that, I’m also trying to improve my physical and mental health. If you want to know anything else, just reach out.

item.title: Books
item.description:
Here you’ll find the books that I’m currently interested in reading. Currently, it’s pretty heavy towards business. Once I complete these, I’ll throw in some fiction for good measure. Recommendations are always welcome!

Currently Reading

  • The Sympathizer - Viet Thanh Nguyen

Up Next

  • The Compound Effect - Darren Hardy
  • Influence: Science and Principle - Robert B. Cialdini
  • Influence: The Psychology of Persuasion - Robert B. Cialdini
  • Mindwise: Why We Misunderstand What Others Think, Believe, Feel, and Want - Nicholas Epley
  • Sprint: How to Solve Big Problems and Test New Ideas in Just Five Days - Jake Knapp and John Zeratsky
  • The Leadership Challenge: How to Make Extraordinary Things Happen in Organizations - James M. Kouzes and Barry Z. Posner

item.title: First Post!
item.description:
Kudos for stumbling upon this blog and more specifically this post. I’m not one for very long worded and fancy intros. So this will be a relatively short post.

This blog has a few purposes. The main purpose is to have somewhere to record my hopefully mildly entertaining life experiences. You probably just asked yourself what type of life experiences might you expect.

Well, this will focus on a two things really. First is my goal towards becoming employed as a software developer. I’ve been involved with technology in some capacity (more than less) for the past 7 years. After trying out a variety of roles, I figured I give software development an actual shot.

Secondly is my fitness journey. As a desk jockey and former Pepsi enthusiast I am not in the best shape I could be. After realizing that it’s easier to get in shape sooner than later figured I start now. As opposed to waiting until I’m in my 40s.

One of the other purposes of this blog is hopefully serve as some motivation (for myself and others)as I progress. As time goes by, it would be great to look back at my former self and see how I’ve changed and improved. Along with that, it would be great if this blog convinced just one other person to do the same.

Besides that, there isn’t much more for me say. The next few posts you’ll see will talk about what I plan on learning and learning plan. Until next time…

  • grxgs
